Fields.DialogueText: I have to hand it to you, Maestrale, you got us back to port faster than I expected.
I wish the storm would've lasted a little longer, but at least I got to enjoy it while it lasted.

Fields.MenuText: You're a strange lady, Maestrale.
We can find you another storm. There's one out there somewhere.
I'm glad somebody enjoyed it. I know more than a few members of the crew were sick from all the rocking.

Fields.DialogueText: You wouldn't be the first to call me that.
That would be nice. Thank you for the consideration, Capitano.
If that's all it took to get them sick, they might want to rethink their station.
I will say one thing. It's good to see a clear sky. I was starting to prune up in all that rain.
I wouldn't think pruning would be a concern of yours, Maestrale.
You don't think Belles can prune?
No... I don't see it detracting from your appearance. No matter the battles we've fought, nor the wind we face, you always look, well... you know what I mean.
Capitano, that's... kind of you to say. Or nearly say, as the case may be.
If the crew hears me giving out compliments freely, they'll start seeking them out as well.
We can't have every officer on board complaining of pruned skin.
No, we cannot.
*ALARM*
The Morganas, on the other hand, always look haggard.
You ought to tell them that to their face.
Perhaps I will.
@BATTLE
I wonder what's for lunch today...
Capitano, I was... DIO! What's wrong with your face?!

Fields.MenuText: What are you talking about?
Rude.
If I had a penny for every time someone asked me that, I'd be rich.

Fields.DialogueText: Look at yourself! You have some sort of horrible rash!
No, I'm not being rude. You have some sort of rash on your face!
Well, there's no reason to get down on yourself. I'm talking about that rash.
Rash? Oh, I guess you're right. How bad is it?
It looks terrible. It doesn't hurt?
No. I must have had some sort of allergic reaction.
I'll take care of this. You're lucky I was the first to see this.
What? Wait, what are you doing?
I'm going to cover up that hideous rash. You look like a raspberry, Capitano.
Maestrale, stop. I'm your captain.
So? Is there some rule against capitani wearing makeup?
Regardless of whether or not there is, it's common decency to ask someone if you can put makeup on their face before you start.
All I'll do is make you look like you do normally. I give you my word that I won't make you look any prettier than you already are.
*ALARM*
We need to go.
Aw, your cheeks are turning red.
@BATTLE
More reports to sign off on. After this stack is done, I can head down to the medical bay and see about a treatment for this rash.
Here to chastise me for doing my duty with a rash again?
Capitano! I need a gun. I need all the guns. Right now!

Fields.MenuText: All right, all right. Give me a moment and you'll have them.
We... need those. You know, for the war.
Why don't you explain why you need "all the guns" first.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? That was easier than I thought it would be.
The war can wait. This battle is at our doorstep.
We don't have time for explanations!
I woke up this morning and I opened my door to find a pair of dirty vermin doing something indecent in the hall.
That really wasn't a visual I needed.
Well, it was either that or fighting. Since they were rats, I assumed the more disgusting option.
For the sake of my mind, we'll go with fighting.
Of course. Can I have the guns now?
To shoot up the hall?
Do you have a better idea?
There has to be a better idea than that.
Very well. I'll figure out some means of defeating those beasts!
She's going to hurt someone, isn't she?
@BATTLE
Make time.
... Okay, fine. If I have to.
*ALARM*
Maestrale, there you are! What are you reading?
Hmmm? Oh, I'm just making my way through La Mia Vita. Have you read it?

Fields.MenuText: Gesundheit.
It's been a while.
I don't think I have. Tell me about it.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't sneeze, Capitano. Don't be stupid. It's the title of the book.
Well then, it's time you had a refresher.
You've never read it? How is that even possible?
It's one of my favorites. I've read it multiple times. Normally, I'm not much for autobiographies, but Mussolini describes his life in such vivid detail. I can't put the book down.
How many times have you read it?
Seven? I'm not sure, but I always discover something new every time I read it. I'm hoping for a sequel.
Well, should it come out, I'll know what to get you for your birthday.
Please, I'm not that patient.
*ALARM*
Looks like you'll have to grab your bookmark. We have Morganas headed this way.
Let's make this quick. I was just getting to my favorite part.
@BATTLE
You rang, Capitano?
I did. I was thinking you might want to hear about our new destination.
We've received a new assignment? I hope it's a good one.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure you'll like it.
Hopefully, you'll find it exciting.
Personally, I hate it.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't say that. You're worrying me.
Well, that's the hope.
Remember, you'll be with me throughout. So no matter where we go, it won't be all gloom and doom.
Don't keep me waiting. Where are we going?
We're heading to the Mediterranean. You'll get to return home.
That's great news! I'll admit, I've been a little homesick.
I'm sure there are several crew members on board who feel the same.
What's our assignment?
*ALARM*
Nothing as urgent as what's directly in front of us.
We can discuss it later.
Good idea. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Maestrale? What are you doing in here?
I'm hiding. They're after me.
Are you talking about the rats again?
Of course I am... Ahhhhh! There's one on your head!
What? What are you talking about?
Wait, that's just your hair. Sorry, but you could really use a haircut.

Fields.MenuText: You think so?
My hair is fine as it is. Besides, we don't have time.
It has been a while.

Fields.DialogueText: I just mistook your unruly mess of hair for a rat. You need a haircut.
Haircuts don't take long at all. It's just snip, snip, done.
Sounds like it's time to grab the scissors!
Can we talk about something besides my hair for a moment? The attention is making me uncomfortable.
There's nothing to be embarrassed about. Leave the styling to me and I'll have you looking great.
You really think I need a haircut?
You don't need one, but I think it would improve your looks. We could all use a little improvement now and then.
*ALARM*
This'll have to wait until later.
I suppose, but give it some thought, Capitano.
@BATTLE
So this lotion's supposed to help the rash? I'm going to need a mirror.
And there's our Belle with that look in her eye...
Die, die, DIE, you hideous beasts!

Fields.MenuText: That's my crew you're shouting at.
I don't see any Morganas around. What are you shouting at?
Maestrale, watch where you're throwing those knives!

Fields.DialogueText: What? No, it's not. Unless you started employing rats behind my back.
The rats, they're everywhere! Don't you see them?!
Don't worry, Capitano. I know what I'm doing.
I still haven't seen any rats, Maestrale. Are you really sure we have an infestation?
That's because you're not looking as hard as I am. If you were, you'd see them everywhere, and you'd be sick.
I need to take care of these pests before we get to Italy. I wouldn't want to be caught dead covered in these vermin.
We have several more important things to worry about.
There, I see one of the little bastards!
*SWOOSH*
Whoa, too close! You're going to hit someone if you throw like that, Maestrale!
Damn it, I missed!
... She's not going to be pleased when I take those knives from her.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It feels good to be back home.
I'm glad you're happy. I thought it might be a little warm for you in those clothes.
Do you have a problem with my clothes?
No! No, of course not. Apologies, I shouldn't have said anything.
When you say things like that, you sound like an idiot!
And when you say things like that, you sound like an ass.
What's that?
It's coming from across the deck.
Ah, you must be the captain. I'm Captain Smith. This is...
I'm Kapitän Fischer. You can call me Adela.
Then you can call me Jack.
A pleasure to meet you both.
What's going on here? Who are these people, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: No idea.
I didn't get to tell you. We'll be working with Adela and Jack for our new assignment.
I told you. Don't you remember?

Fields.DialogueText: You're absolutely no help whatsoever. What's going on?
Working with? Are we escorting them somewhere?
You told me no such thing. Can someone explain this to me? Now, please.
You should better control your Belle, Kapitän.
There's been talk of a Morgana threat looming over the Mediterranean Sea. We've been assigned to search it out.
That's it? What a bore.
Not the way I do things.
That's why you're an idiot.
*ALARM*
Sounds like we have company.
Well, if we can stop fighting for just a second, they shouldn't stand a chance.
I wouldn't count on that.
They... don't like each other.
No, they do not. Let's hope they'll aim at the Morganas and not at each other.
@BATTLE
This assignment might not go as smoothly as I had hoped.
Really? What was your first hint? The arguing, or the way Jack and Adela almost blew each other up in that last fight?

Fields.MenuText: The arguing.
They were trying to blow each other up?
What? I was talking about how we ran out of chicken.

Fields.DialogueText: That was rhetorical, Capitano.
You didn't notice? Either their gunners have horrible aim, or they have it out for one another.
Stop the presses! We ran out of chicken!? This is a major problem!
Do you think we can convince the other captains to get along, Maestrale?
No. That's a storm not even I can navigate. But I think we can separate them and keep them focused on the assignment in front of us.
Separate them? That's not a bad idea. If we act as an intermediary, we can keep the fighting to a minimum.
My thoughts exactly.
*ALARM*
More Morganas?
That, or the capitani are it again.
Either way, we have a mess to clean up.
@BATTLE
We have more on the way.
Oh, thank goodness.
Moving on...
Capitano Fischer is here to discuss matters with you, Capitano.
Great. Adela, I'm glad you could arrive so soon.
Where's Smith? Is he running late again?
Actually, I wanted to have this discussion with you alone.
Very well...
Maestrale, why don't you start us out?
Of course. Capitano Fischer, we were hoping to divide the search into sectors, and we would like for you to start here, at sector three. What do you think?
Where will you and Smith be stationed?

Fields.MenuText: Smith will be at sector one, as far from you as possible. We figured you'd prefer it that way.

Fields.DialogueText: You figured correctly... All right. I can handle this. I assume we'll meet back in Italy to discuss our findings?
Exactly.
Understood. I'll be on my way, then.
Oh, before I leave, I thought you might want to know I saw a few rats on my way in. You might want to take care of those.
Dammit! I thought I got them all!
When it comes to vermin, for every one you see, there are two hidden.
They'll all die, hidden or not.
With that kind of attitude, I believe it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Smith has more experience than you, so they'll take sector one.
Smith is taking sector one. I figured you'd be a better match for the tougher sectors on the other side.

Fields.DialogueText: Your assessment is wrong, but I don't mind getting the easy duty.
Leave the real work for the experts. I agree.
Maestrale, are you swabbing the deck?
That's not my job. I'm catching rats. Watch where you step.
What is this stuff?
I'm making the deck one big glue trap.

Fields.MenuText: This sounds like a good idea to you?
What brilliance.
... I give up.

Fields.DialogueText: I wanted to shoot the rats, but you said no. I tried to throw knives at them, but you confiscated those. My available options keep shrinking in number.
You think so? I wasn't sure about it myself. It's a last ditch effort.
Hopefully the vermin will soon share that thought.
Now, I have more glue to lay out. I have to hurry before it dries!
Uh, Captain, is this a bad time?
No, but you might want to stay where you are.
Hmmm, I won't ask. I just wanted to check in with you one last time before we headed out.
Sounds as if we're ahead of schedule. Maestrale! Wrap it up!
I'm hurrying!
Don't take too long. We can't have you slowing us down.
*ALARM*
Enough with the glue, Maestrale!
Obviously! I'm stopping!
Hope you don't mind a little assistance.
Never. A little help is always welcome.
@BATTLE
Capitano, I need a distraction.
Distraction? From what? We've just started searching our sector.
I need to stop thinking about the vermin crawling all over every inch of my ship.
... What's with the scissors?
It's time for that haircut you desperately need, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: *sigh* You really want to do this, don't you?
That doesn't sound like the worst thing in the world...
My hair has gotten to be a bit of a nuisance. Bring those scissors on over.

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, it'll be fun, Capitano. You can trust me.
Right? The worst things in the world are those disgusting... No, I need to stop focusing on them!
That's the kind of attitude I like.
Perfect. Just lean back and close your eyes. I can handle it from there.
If I do that, I might end up falling asleep.
That's fine, let yourself relax. I'll wake you up if the world ends.
Don't even joke about that. It could happen.
One could argue that it has already happened. Sweet dreams, Capitano.
Heh... you certainly know how to put a person at ease.
Morganas off the beam! Get us to battle stations, Maestrale.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I need to go over those charts with the navigator...
Hey there, Capitano! Looking sharp.

Fields.MenuText: I never get tired of you greeting me like that.
You don't have to say that every time you see me, Maestrale.
Heheheh, I do look sharp.

Fields.DialogueText: What can I say? I like appreciating my good work.
I'd stop, but you look good. I can't help myself.
I'm glad you're enjoying your new look!
Anything to report?
No, we haven't found any signs of a Morgana base.
That's disappointing. I hope the others are having better luck.
Do we even know what we're looking for, Capitano? A "looming Morgana threat" isn't much to go on.
I know, but we need to trust Command's intel. We'll know what we're looking for when we see it.
Or we'll miss it completely. But you're right, we need to trust what information we've been given. Even if that intel keeps us sailing in circles in the middle of the Mediterranean.
Oh! Capitano, we have trouble.
Morganas? How many?
A handful. Not enough to be the threat we're looking for, but enough to be a nuisance.
Think of them as a good way to get some of that frustration out.
I'm way ahead of you.
@BATTLE
*sigh* This is so booooooring!
What do you mean? The waves are pretty rough today. I figured you'd be thrilled.
The waves are nice, but they're nothing I haven't experienced before. We're in my waters now, after all. What I wouldn't give for a nice storm right about now!

Fields.MenuText: Why stop at a storm? Let's start praying for a typhoon, or a massive whirlpool.
Should I ask for another assignment? Command might have other work we can do.
Will you ever stop chasing storms, Maestrale?

Fields.DialogueText: You jest, but you wouldn't enjoy those opportunities.
No, no, I would never. Italy's reputation depends on her Belles representing her well. I shouldn't complain.
I hope not. The day I stop chasing storms is the day that a storm finally sinks me.
I just want a little more excitement in our day to day routine.
*ALARM*
Heh, you asked for it.
Not exactly what I meant, but I'll take it.
@BATTLE
Maestrale, what's going on down here?
Shh! Get down here!
What in the hell? Is there a reason we're hiding?
See that trap?
The one in the middle of the floor?
Well, I had to make sure the idiotic beast spotted it. I'm waiting to see if it works.

Fields.MenuText: You ever hear the saying "A watched pot never boils?"
I'm surprised you started with glue and then proceeded to rat traps. Usually, it works the other way around.
Care for a little company? I know it's a little cramped, but...

Fields.DialogueText: No... and what does that have to do with anything? I'm not planning on cooking the nuisance.
I started with traps, but they didn't work. The rats found some way of taking the food without triggering the trap. That's why I'm watching now, to figure out how they do it.
There's plenty of room! Squeeze in close to me.
Maybe the rats are full already.
They have been stealing food from all the other traps.
... Were you looking for me for some reason?
I wanted to let you know we're heading back to rendezvous with the others.
We finished searching our sector?
Not long ago.
*ALARM*
Damn, that came out of nowhere! Morganas and their horrible timing!
Maestrale, look, you'll miss it!
What? Is it a rat? Hey, the cheese is gone! Again!
The little guy snatched it off the trap. You might have to drop the adjective "idiotic" in the future.
We're fighting a war on two fronts...
*BOOM*
Sounds like the other front is calling.
Rat, I will have my revenge! Just you wait!
@BATTLE
Sorry I'm late. Did I miss anything?
Just a lot of screaming and name calling.
What a shame I missed that.
Now that we're all here, can we start the debriefing?
Oh, now you're all business. When I brought it up, you...
Okay, how about we start, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: No, let's see where this goes. I have money on Smith breaking into tears.
Excellent suggestion, Maestrale. Nothing I can say would be as interesting as this fistfight, but I'll give it a shot.
Wait, me? I'm totally unprepared. I was going to let you do the talking and add my two cents every now and then.

Fields.DialogueText: That is the last thing I want to see. I have a feeling he's not an attractive crier.
If you don't think you have what it takes to draw their attention, I can always give it a shot.
That better be an unfortunate attempt at humor, Capitano.
After searching high and low throughout our sector, we found nothing alerting us to the presence of some powerful threat.
My experience was the same. Sector three was calm and docile. We hardly encountered a single Morgana.
How fortunate for you. Morganas were crawling over every inch of my sector. Every inch I could explore, at least.
What do you mean?
There was a reef which made movement difficult. Several nearby wrecks didn't help the issue.
Why didn't you investigate further? That area must be our target.
I had no way of knowing whether you would find similar conditions in your sectors. I thought it best to return and tell you my findings.
This is why you're an idiot.
*ALARM*
The two of you can fight later, but for now, we need to work together. We need to start acting like an actual team. A triumvirate, if you will.
A what?
Read a book, you fool. After this fight.
@BATTLE
W-what, what's going on?
Capitano, no, put your head back down! I'm not finished yet.
What are you doing?!
You needed a touchup. I noticed during the Triumvirate meeting.

Fields.MenuText: Is that our title now? I kind of like it.
Get off me! This isn't how I wanted to wake up!
Hurry up. I think I'm resting my face in my own drool.

Fields.DialogueText: Right? It has a great ring to it. Rome had the best names.
Well, excuse me! Next time I'll bring a sandwich! If I stop now, you'll have every crew member laughing behind your back, and possibly to your face.
I'm moving as fast as I can. You can't rush genius!
... There, finished. Now you can move.
Did you have to do that while I was sleeping?
It's not like I snuck into your room in the middle of the night with a pair of shears. You fell asleep at your desk, and I merely took advantage.
I need something to drink.
If it makes you less angry, you look great.
I'm not angry. Just wake me up next time, okay?
Okay, okay. I suppose giving a little warning wouldn't kill me.
I'd better find a mirror.
No time!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I've checked the bridge and my desk, but still no mirror.
And it looks like other priorities have shown up.
Hello, Captain. I was hoping to discuss our assignment with you and Maestrale in private.

Fields.MenuText: I was about to contact you. Excellent timing.
Is anything unclear? We sail out, we defeat whatever Morganas we find, we move on to our next assignment.
You wouldn't happen to have a hand mirror, would you?

Fields.DialogueText: Perfect. Without that vicious German pixie nearby, we might be able to come up with a decent plan.
What... confidence you have, Captain.
On me? No... Captain.
Did you do something with your hair? You look... different.
Just a little touchup. Maestrale tells me I look sharp.
I'd agree with her. That reminds me, I think I'm due for a haircut myself.
Capitano Smith, you're getting off track. Please, describe the waters you searched in greater detail.
My apologies. The waters are quite choppy, and there's significant debris which must be navigated around.
I believe that reef I mentioned is a recent addition. I sailed those same waters not long ago, and their current state is a major change.
If you had to rate the navigability of the area, on a scale from one to ten, perhaps, where would it fall?
A one, for certain.
A one? How disappointing.
One being the worst, of course.
Oh... oh! Wonderful.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Again.
Cheer up. Judging by the looks of them, if I had to rate the difficulty of this upcoming fight, I'd give it a ten. We won't even break a sweat.
Who rates things backwards like that?
Capitano Smith, clearly.
@BATTLE
Ah, finally found that mirror. Maestrale does have an interesting sense of style.
Speak of the devil...
Capitano, what would you think about a nonlethal attempt at catching these vermin?

Fields.MenuText: You've been trying to kill them this whole time? You've been doing a horrible job.
Wouldn't you be disappointed? I thought you were going to mount their heads as trophies on your wall.
I like my rats dead, with a side of bacon.

Fields.DialogueText: Hush, you! I know. That's why I'm thinking about doing things differently.
Capitano! I would never! My main priority is getting the rats off my ship.
That is the most disgusting thing I've ever heard. Don't ever eat rats. Just don't.
So you're getting a little soft on the pests, are you?
No, not at all! I'm just tired of failing. The rats... they're... they're outthinking me.
They must be significantly more clever than your average rat, if that's the case.
I'm frazzled. It's difficult to think straight when you can feel vermin crawling all over you.
I can understand that. If I were you, I'd do whatever was necessary. If you need my help, let me know.
Thank you, Capitano. I think I have a plan... Nets. Nets and cheese. That's what I need.
Yeah, that sounds like it'll work out.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Are we good to depart?
Yes, Capitano. We are ready to go.
Everything is restocked?
Mhmmmm.
What about the other captains? Are they ready as well?
Yes, yes! I said we were good to go. Did I stutter?

Fields.MenuText: I'm just being careful. Don't get snippy with me, Snip-strale.
You're right, I'm sorry. You know what you're doing.
Actually, you d-d-d-did.

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh. How dreadful. You need to work on your creativity, Capitano.
I do. So when I say we're good to go, that means I've checked everything ahead of time.
Not funny, Capitano. What if Seaman Gallo heard you and thought you were making fun of him? What's next, are you going to make fun of Seaman Harmon's lisp? So insensitive.
Looks like we're getting left behind.
What!? How could they do that? We're not the Triumvirate if we're not working together. Then they're just a... bi-umvirate. That doesn't have the same ring to it.
Good enough for me. Let's catch up with them.
Right, we need to lead the way anyway. How else are we going to get through that reef?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Charts, check. Heading, check. My favorite snack, check.
Our exasperated Belle, check.
Capitano, when this is all over, can we take a vacation? I could use a bit of a break.

Fields.MenuText: A vacation? Probably not. We're in the middle of a war.
I'd need to talk to Command, but if we do well with this assignment, they might give us a few days off.
No! Not until we kill all the Morganas!

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt a few days off would make or break the war effort.
Grazie, Capitano. I think the time off would do us good.
Woah. I told the officers to make sure you were switched to decaf...
The crew has been working diligently. A few days off would probably be good for us all.
Now, before you change your mind, I'm going to go back to my post.
Wait, actually, I wanted to ask...
Yes?
You're... happy, aren't you, Maestrale? Here, with me? You've seemed a little tense recently.
With those capitani constantly at each other's throats, it's no wonder I'm a little tense.
You didn't exactly answer my question.
Well, if you need me to spell it out for you... of course I'm happy, Capitano. I apologize if my tendency to take out my frustrations on you has made you question that.
Thanks.
Anything else to address before I leave?
Should we get that break, I think the two of us should have dinner sometime.
Just the two of us?
Sure. We get along well as is. I think it would be nice to interact in a non-work setting.
Capitano, you don't need to say any more. I think that would be a wonderful idea!
*ALARM*
We can continue this conversation later.
We certainly will continue this conversation later.
@BATTLE
*smirk*
Very funny.
Morgana patrol ahead!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're coming up on the reef, Capitano!
We're stuck between Morganas and a hard place.

Fields.MenuText: This... could make things tricky.
Huh? I don't get it.
That's an excellent idea. Let's hit the Morganas with the hard place!

Fields.DialogueText: One wrong move and we could join the shipwrecks around us.
If we move in the wrong direction during this skirmish, we might not sail away from it!
What? Oh, you mean we're not the only ones inconvenienced by the reef! You're not wrong there, Capitano.
*BOOM*
They're getting closer!
The other members of the Triumvirate have already engaged. Let's hurry to catch up with them.
You know, I wasn't sure that name would catch on at first, but it is. I've heard several officers use it as well.
We should have some sort of visual identifier. Like matching hats. No! Matching jackets!
Let's not get carried away...
Just one more application of this lotion, and the doctor said I'd be free of the rash's remnants.
Capitano, I did it! I finally did it! Rat-ageddon is over!

Fields.MenuText: Weren't you supposed to be navigating us through these waters?
Please, Maestrale, the clear choice was Arma-vermin. It rolls off the tongue.
Congratulations. I guess I'd better start calling you "The Exterminator" now.

Fields.DialogueText: I am. That I'm accomplishing both simultaneously only makes the feats that much more impressive.
I don't think so. Poll the crew... half won't have any idea what you mean.
Please don't. That's a terrible nickname.
So did you end up using lethal or nonlethal means?
Nonlethal. The rats weren't expecting that approach, and that was their mistake. Want to see them?
No, that's okay. I just ate.
Come on, they're right here.
That's it? There are only two of them.
If I hadn't caught them, they would have multiplied.
Oh, well, I guess you have a point. Which one's the female?
They're both male.
Wait, then how do you think they would've multiplied?
There are ways.
What?!
*ALARM*
Oh, great. Now we have to fight in the thick of this ship graveyard.
... "There are ways?"
@BATTLE
Looks like the Morganas have banded together into a team of their own.
So I guess this will be the showdown. The fight to decide which team is better.
Well, clearly, we are. We've had more practice.

Fields.MenuText: I mean, Fischer and Smith have had more practice fighting one another...
Now let's prove it.
There's only one way to find out.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, we might have a small issue with teamwork. But you can't convince me that any team of Morganas could ever truly challenge us.
I'd rather not, but our assignment requires us to fight these beasts, doesn't it?
I disagree. There are a number of ways we could find out. We could have a contest, we could have a race, we could...
*BOOM*
They're coming for us.
That shot came from Capitano Smith, but they're coming for us now.
No use in waiting for them. Let's meet them halfway.
@BATTLE
Most certainly.
Now I get to take us back home the rough way.
Is that why you're in such a good mood? I suppose navigating through a storm is all it would take to make your day.
That might be part of it.
What's the other part?
So the second thing... I seem to remember an aforementioned conversation about the two of us having dinner?
Ah, yes. That's a conversation we've yet to finish.
I've been thinking about that dinner, and about the perfect place to go.
Really? What did you come up with?

Fields.MenuText: Well, I hear there's a particularly dangerous storm up north near the Soviet Union. I figured we could eat, and then sail. Or sail, and then eat. Either way.

Fields.DialogueText: That does sound ideal, although I'm not sure I'll be able to properly concentrate on my food if my focus is also on keeping the ship from breaking apart.
That's a good point. We can perfect our dinner plans in the coming days.
We'd better. The more we talk about it, the more I'm looking forward to it.
Perfect.
Also, we must have panna cotta for dessert. No dinner is complete without it.
I'm sure the cook's going to be thrilled to hear that.
Capitano, come on! We must discuss the menu!
All right, all right. I'm coming!

Fields.MenuText: Somehwere quiet. A dead calm. Just you, a nice meal, and me.

Fields.DialogueText: Dead calm? Well... actually, that's sort of interesting. Sounds really intimate.

Fields.MenuText: How about this. No plans, just a time. Then we go wherever the winds carry us, together.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew you understood my heart, Capitano!
But let's not plan too much right now. Let's just enjoy the feeling.
I'll tell you after we clean the air of these foul intruders...
@BATTLE
